intro: Cacalia zuccariniana, commonly known as the Zuccarinian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in a cluster resembling a bell. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cacalia zuccariniana is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
